node.display_long_description:
"Insanely addictive" - VRFocus
“A fast-paced light gun shooter with addictive arcade mechanics” - NathieVR
“The gameplay is incredibly fun and it’s really addictive” - BMF VR
“The headshot activated slowmo is seriously addictive” - Cerberusarms

Award-winning Zombieland: Headshot Fever is an arcade light-gun game built for VR.

This zombie-killing race sport brings light-gun games into the 21st century! Headshot combos slow the clock, meaning the most precise shooter is the fastest - challenge the leaderboards with skill, speed, and accuracy.

Then perform on the world stage! Sign up for the inaugural Zombieland Invitational, in association with VR Master League, by visiting zombielandvrgame.com, and become the fastest zombie killer in the world! 

FEATURES
Bullet Time - Two headshots turn the world slow!
Leaderboards - Challenge the world!
Weapons - Unlock and upgrade a range of weapons!
The Zombieland Invitational - Take on the most dangerous zombie killing race course ever devised!
node.publisher_name: XR Games / Sony Pictures Virtual Reality

nodes.title: v1.3.0: Reworked graphics, Quest 2 upgrades, a brand new level, two remixed levels and more!
nodes.body_text:
Hello!

It’s been six weeks since our last update, and the team has been working on something pretty special.

Introducing the Kingpin Update for Zombieland: Headshot Fever!

This update is a big one.

- Reworked graphics!
- Big Quest 2 upgrades!
- Two remixed levels!
- One completely brand new level!

This update also addresses as many comments from our players as possible, including cloud saves, further gun position customisation options, and more.

We hope you all enjoy!

P.S. We have an official Zombieland community on Discord! Head over to discord.gg/zombielandvr to hear the latest updates, find out what we’re up to and take on some of the best Zombieland players around.



For this patch (1.3.0):

Major Additions and Changes
- The game now supports cloud saves
- Reworked graphics
- Improved environments and resolution for Quest 1 and Quest 2
- Dynamic lights and shadows for Quest 2
- Zombie mesh and texture refinements
- Reworked gun vfx including muzzle flash and bullet impacts
- A whole new level! Visit the Bowling Realm! (Level available once Zombieland Invitational is unlocked)
- Two remixed levels, Barrel Fever and TP Farm! (Levels available once - Zombieland Invitational is unlocked)
- Win 4 new gun skins from new level missions
- Improved collision models for all levels
- Customise gun tilt angles in the options menu:
- Default -- our fine-tuned presets :)
- Relative -- adjust tilting angle relative to developer presets
- Absolute -- set absolute tilting angle for all guns, ignoring presets



Small Tweaks
- Replay the cutscenes via pause menu in the mansion (‘Memories’)
- Scoring screen now shows both real world time and adrenaline-modified run time; perfect your adrenaline combos!
- See target times for all ranks by hovering over the ‘Target Time’ panel on the level select menu. S Rank time is also visible after you beat A Rank.
- Gun range scoring screen has been reworked
- If you have no controller connected when launching the game, it’ll ask you to connect one instead of showing a black screen
- VRML event portal added - look out for future Headshot Fever events!

Fixes
- Improved zombie animations when killed by explosions
- Zombie movement fixes
- Reloading bug (reloading multiple times in a row breaks gun) is fixed
- Bug fixes

nodes.title: Zombieland VR: Headshot Fever v1.2.5 out now!
nodes.body_text:
Hello!

It’s the end of April, which marks a full month since we released Zombieland: Headshot Fever! Thank you to everyone who’s played and enjoyed the game, especially those that have taken the time to leave a review. It means the world.

Now onto this month’s update.

We’re happy to report that v1.2.5 brings the ability for users to change the height and position of their gun belt. We know a lot of you have requested this feature, so we were happy to get it in this patch. As well as that there’s some vibration options, a new particle effect, and a bunch of quality of life improvements.

We're always listening to the community, so head over to our Discord at discord.gg/zombielandvr to let us know what else you'd like to see in future updates.

Thanks for reading. Here are the patch notes:

For this patch (1.2.5):

- Weapon Belt height is now adjustable from Gameplay Options.
- Holster position is now centered in the gun range for ease of use.
- Turn the vibrations on/off in the Gameplay Options.
- Added haptic feedback for all menus.
- Bullet decals and impact sound effects have been improved.
- New optimised explosion particle effect for the explosive barrels and canisters.
- All levels have received another pass with improved collisions.
- Final boss animations have been tweaked and improved.
- Adjusted gameplay dialogues triggers, resulting in less harsh comments on some slow runs.
- Updated A-Z Tooltip description.
- Bugs have been chased down and blasted wherever possible.

node.reviewDescription:
UPDATE: With the latest update, the game now has extra levels, higher resolution textures, new environmental VFX, the Quest 2 version now supports dynamic lights, pixel lights and realtime shadows and the PCVR version has even more bells and whistles. The game runs great, plenty to do, still very addictive and lots of fun.

Well worth buying! 5 out of 5 stars!!!

ORIGINAL: I've played a large range of games growning up ranging from the old light gun games on the Sinclair ZX Spectrum, Die Hard 2 on the PlayStation, Time Crisis and other arcade games... so when I saw Zombieland: Headshot Fever I thought I knew what I was going to expect, a quick play and then nothing more... Boy was I wrong!

To say I'm hooked would be selling it short. You'll find your self playing levels over and over just trying to scrape precious seconds off your time just to reach higher on the leaderboards.

The artstyle is a delight and the game runs very well on the Quest 2 standalone and when hooked up to the PC. The game supports Cross-buy and is well worth the price tag.

I hope in future other courses/levels are added.

If you're looking for a light gun shooter that will keep you coming back for more, you owe it to yourself to grab this game!

developerResponse.body:
Thanks for the amazing review GameOnScorpio!

Last week's Kingpin Update was our biggest update yet, with new levels, big graphical changes and Quest 1 improvements, but there's plenty coming in the future.
